events.event_name: S&P Global South Africa PMI Release (January 2026)
events.description: The S&P Global South Africa PMI rose to 50.0 in January 2026, signaling a stabilization in private-sector business conditions.

facts.fact_text: The S&P Global South Africa PMI rose to 50.0 in January 2026 from 47.7 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P Global South Africa PMI rose to 50.0 in January 2026 from 47.7 in December

facts.fact_text: Supplier delivery times lengthened for the first time in ten months.

evidences.evidence_text: supplier delivery times lengthened for the first time in ten months due to port delays and weaker supplier performance

facts.fact_text: Input cost inflation slowed to a three-month low.

evidences.evidence_text: input cost inflation slowed to a three-month low

facts.fact_text: Employment edged lower as firms reduced staff or paused hiring.

evidences.evidence_text: employment edged lower as firms reduced staff or paused hiring

claims.claim_text: Business confidence stayed relatively upbeat despite challenges.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: Despite challenges, business confidence stayed relatively upbeat

claims.claim_text: Business confidence is supported by expectations of stronger demand and improved energy supply.
claims.author: private sector firms

evidences.evidence_text: supported by expectations of stronger demand, improved energy supply, rising tourism, and better domestic economic conditions

evidence.evidence_text: supplier delivery times lengthened for the first time in ten months due to port delays
input cost inflation slowed to a three-month low, allowing selling price increases to soften
Purchasing activity increased slightly on firmer demand momentum
